original.definition: make a record of; set down in permanent form

sememes.reasoning: The definition 'set down in permanent form' indicates a change from a non-recorded to a recorded state, implying information storage. In this non-agentive frame, 'record' functions as an inchoative verb meaning 'to become recorded'.

participants.reasoning: The 'Something' in the frame is the entity that undergoes the change, becoming recorded or stored.
The 'somebody' in the frame acts as the location or recipient where the 'Something' is stored or becomes recorded, as implied by the action of 'enter' within the frame.

Evidentiality.reasoning: The act of something becoming recorded (by entering) can be a directly observed or experienced event.

Mood.reasoning: The verb's core meaning in this frame is declarative, stating an occurrence.

Modality.reasoning: The subject 'Something' implies no inherent will or intention, thus the action is not driven by will.

Polarity.reasoning: The act of something becoming recorded is neutral; its sentiment depends on context.

Volitionality.reasoning: The frame 'Something enter somebody' indicates a non-volitional subject ('Something') and a passive recipient ('somebody'), making the action inherently non-volitional for both.

Confidence.reasoning: The verb 'record' implies a definite occurrence of the information being set down or stored.

Iterativity.reasoning: The lexeme describes a single instance of something becoming recorded or entering a state of permanence.

sememes.reasoning: verb_property 'information_storage.n.01' is not a valid synset in NLTK.

candidates.description: a nonvolatile storage device that holds information in the form of bubbles on a thin film of magnetic silicate; no longer used in most computers (gloss match)

the most common computer memory which can be used by programs to perform necessary tasks while the computer is on; an integrated circuit memory chip allows information to be stored or accessed in any order and all storage locations are equally accessible (gloss match)
a storage device on which information (sounds or images) have been recorded (gloss match)
(computer science) a high-speed internal memory used for temporary storage of preliminary information (gloss match)
a measure of how densely information is packed on a storage medium (gloss match)
a piece of stored information that is used to identify an item in an information storage and retrieval system (gloss match)
any storage medium in which different patterns of magnetization are used to represent stored bits or bytes of information (gloss match)
electronic transmission of information that has been encoded digitally (as for storage and processing by computers) (gloss match)
relational database of the United States National Library of Medicine for the storage and retrieval of bibliographical information concerning the biomedical literature (gloss match)

sememes.corrected_reasoning: Semantically and contextually the best match from candidates, referring to a storage device for recorded information, directly aligning with the verb 'record'.
